what: Integration Unit Tests for Pharmacoepidemiolological Studies
title: Integration Unit Tests for Pharmacoepidemiolological Studies
text: cohort picked correct number patients? calculating intersection right way? expected value treatment duration? just takes one incorrect parameter get incoherent results pharmacoepidemiological study, challenging test calculations huge complex databases. TestGenerator useful push micro sample around 10 patients unit test study OMOP-CDM. includes tools create blank CDM complete vocabulary check code expect. package based unit testing written Eramus MC Ranitidine Study.

title: Integration Unit Tests for Pharmacoepidemiolological Studies
text: install development version TestGenerator:

title: Integration Unit Tests for Pharmacoepidemiolological Studies
text: user provide Excel file (link sample) micro population around 10 patients testing purposes. can include table OMOP-CDM. readPatients() read Excel file, saves data JSON file. useful user wants create one Unit Test Definitions. patientCDM() pushes one Unit Test Definitions blank CDM reference complete version vocabulary. Now user CDM reference complete vocabulary just 10 patients unit test functions particular study.
code: TestGenerator::readPatients(   filePath = "~/pathto/testPatients.xlsx",   testName = "test",   outputPath = "inst/testCases" ) cdm <- TestGenerator::patientsCDM(   pathJson = "inst/testCases",    testName = "test") #> Unit Test Definition created successfully: test #> Patients pushed to blank CDM successfully #> # OMOP CDM reference (tbl_duckdb_connection) #>  #> Tables: person, observation_period, visit_occurrence, visit_detail, condition_occurrence, drug_exposure, procedure_occurrence, device_exposure, measurement, observation, death, note, note_nlp, specimen, fact_relationship, location, care_site, provider, payer_plan_period, cost, drug_era, dose_era, condition_era, metadata, cdm_source, concept, vocabulary, domain, concept_class, concept_relationship, relationship, concept_synonym, concept_ancestor, source_to_concept_map, drug_strength, cohort_definition, attribute_definition  #> # Source:   table<person> [?? x 18] #> # Database: DuckDB v0.9.1 [cbarboza@Windows 10 x64:R 4.3.1/C:\Users\cbarboza\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpOkRH5L\file6b2815fa5970.duckdb] #>    person_id gender_concept_id year_of_birth month_of_birth day_of_birth #>        <int>             <int>         <int>          <int>        <int> #>  1         1              8532          1980             NA           NA #>  2         2              8507          1980             NA           NA #>  3         3              8532          1965             NA           NA #>  4         4              8532          2010             NA           NA #>  5         5              8532          1936             NA           NA #>  6         6              8532          1970             NA           NA #>  7         7              8532          1988             NA           NA #>  8         8              8507          1998             NA           NA #>  9         9              8507          1990             NA           NA #> 10        10              8532          1945             NA           NA #> # ℹ more rows #> # ℹ 13 more variables: birth_datetime <dttm>, race_concept_id <int>, #> #   ethnicity_concept_id <int>, location_id <int>, provider_id <int>, #> #   care_site_id <int>, person_source_value <chr>, gender_source_value <chr>, #> #   gender_source_concept_id <int>, race_source_value <chr>, #> #   race_source_concept_id <int>, ethnicity_source_value <chr>, #> #   ethnicity_source_concept_id <int>

Pushes test population into a blank CDM. — patientsCDM
text: pathJson Directory sample populations json located. NULL, gets default inst/testCases directory. testName Name sample population JSON file. NULL push first sample population testCases directory.

title: Pushes test population into a blank CDM. — patientsCDM
text: CDM reference object sample population.

title: Pushes test population into a blank CDM. — patientsCDM
code: # \donttest{ filePath <- system.file("extdata", "testPatientsRSV.xlsx", package = "TestGenerator") TestGenerator::readPatients(filePath = filePath, outputPath = tempdir()) #> Unit Test Definition created successfully: test cdm <- TestGenerator::patientsCDM(pathJson = tempdir(), testName = "test") #>  #> Download completed! #> Creating CDM database /tmp/RtmpjgDAXT/synthea-allergies-10k_5.3.zip #> ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■            70% | ETA:  2s #> ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■      89% | ETA:  2s #> ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■     95% | ETA:  1s #> Patients pushed to blank CDM successfully duckdb::duckdb_shutdown(duckdb::duckdb()) # }

what: Converts a sample of patients in XLSX format into Unit Testing Definition in JSON format. — readPatients
title: Converts a sample of patients in XLSX format into Unit Testing Definition in JSON format. — readPatients
text: Converts sample patients XLSX format Unit Testing Definition JSON format.

title: Converts a sample of patients in XLSX format into Unit Testing Definition in JSON format. — readPatients
Converts a sample of patients in XLSX format into Unit Testing Definition in JSON format. — readPatients
text: filePath Path test patient data Excel format. Excel sheets represent tables OMOP-CDM, e.g. person, drug_exposure, condition_ocurrence, etc. testName name test population character. outputPath Path output file, NULL, folder created project folder inst/testCases.

title: Converts a sample of patients in XLSX format into Unit Testing Definition in JSON format. — readPatients
text: JSON file sample patients inside project directory.

title: Converts a sample of patients in XLSX format into Unit Testing Definition in JSON format. — readPatients
code: filePath <- system.file("extdata", "testPatientsRSV.xlsx", package = "TestGenerator") readPatients(filePath = filePath, outputPath = tempdir()) #> Unit Test Definition created successfully: test
